title: Wise (TransferWise) Reports $10 Billion Profit – Bigger Than JPMorgan
shortdescription: UK fintech disrupts global remittances — now most profitable bank on earth.
author: Gwen John

content.content: Wise, formerly known as TransferWise, has reported $10 billion in annual profit — surpassing JPMorgan Chase's net income and making it the most profitable financial institution on Earth. The UK-based fintech has disrupted the $800 billion global remittance market with its transparent pricing and instant cross-border transfers. Wise now processes 25 million customer transactions monthly across 160 countries, with average transfer fees of just 0.5% compared to traditional banks' 7%.

The company's zero-fee international transfers and 5% interest-bearing accounts have attracted 50 million users, including 15 million small businesses. Wise's banking license allows it to hold customer deposits and lend against them, creating a powerful balance sheet that generated $3.2 billion in net interest income last quarter alone. The platform's API has become the standard for fintech integration, powering services from Shopify to Uber.

Wise has fundamentally changed how the world moves money. Traditional banks that charged $50 for a $1,000 international wire transfer now face existential threats. The company's success proves that transparency and technology can disrupt even the most entrenched financial industries. Wise's $45 billion valuation reflects its position as the preeminent global payment infrastructure provider of the digital age.
